Title: Mujadarra (Lentils with Rice)
Ingredients: ['14 ounces dry brown lentils', '2 carrots, grated', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 onions, thinly sliced', '3 cloves garlic, crushed, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons water, or more as needed', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon yellow curry powder', '4 cups cooked brown rice, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water; add lentils and bring to a rolling boil.
', 'Step 2: Cook until slightly tender, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add grated carrots; cook until slightly softened, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain lentils and carrots.
', 'Step 5: Heat olive oil in the same pot over medium heat; add onions and garlic.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until onions wilt and become transparent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in lentils and carrots and reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 8: Add enough water to the pot to keep the lentil mixture from drying out.
', 'Step 9: Sprinkle cumin, cayenne, curry powder, salt, and pepper over lentils; stir until heated through and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Serve over rice.
']

Title: Shawarma Seasoning

Cooking Instructions: ['Step 1: Mix garlic powder, black pepper, allspice, nutmeg, cinnamon, cardamom, chili powder, oregano, salt, and cloves together in a bowl.\n']

Title: Afghani Kabli Pulao
Ingredients: ['2 cups sella basmati rice', '5 cardamom pods, divided', '1 onion, peeled and halved', '1 whole head garlic, loose skins removed', '5 whole cloves, divided', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper, divided', '2 teaspoons cumin seed, divided', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '1 cinnamon stick', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon coriander seeds', '3 ½ cups water', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup carrots, chopped into matchstick pieces', '3 cloves garlic', '½ cup raisins', '½ cup slivered almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak the rice in cool water for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Rinse until water runs clear.
', 'Step 3: Place 4 cardamom pods on a cutting board and lightly crush using the flat side of a knife; transfer to a pressure cooker.
', 'Step 4: Add halved onion, garlic head, 4 cloves, 1 teaspoon black pepper, 1 teaspoon cumin seed, salt, sugar, cinnamon stick, paprika, and coriander seeds.
', 'Step 5: Pour in water to cover.
', 'Step 6: Seal pressure cooker lid and turn heat to high.
', 'Step 7: Cook until pressure cooker whistles once, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 9: Wait for 2 more whistles, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove from heat and allow pressure to release naturally, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Strain broth into a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Clean out the pressure cooker and heat it over medium heat.
', 'Step 13: Add oil and chopped onion; cook and stir until softened and browned, about 7 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Add carrots; cook until soft, about 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 15: Add raisins, almonds, and strained rice.
', 'Step 16: Add remaining 1 teaspoon black pepper, remaining 1 teaspoon cumin seed, and remaining clove.
', 'Step 17: Crush remaining cardamom seed to a powder and add to the pressure cooker.
', 'Step 18: Mix to combine; pour in enough broth to cover the rice.
', 'Step 19: Increase heat to high and seal the pressure cooker.
', 'Step 20: Cook until the first whistle, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 21: Reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 22: Cook for 5 minutes and remove from heat.
', 'Step 23: Let rest for 7 minutes; release the pressure naturally, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 24: Transfer cooked rice to a serving dish immediately to prevent overcooking.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '378.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '70.7 g', 'fatContent': '8.2 g', 'fiberContent': '3.9 g', 'proteinContent': '8.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '401.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.1 g'}

Title: Khachapuri (Georgian Cheese Bread)
Ingredients: ['½ cup warm milk', '⅓ cup warm water', '1 ½ teaspoons white sugar', '1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast', '2 teaspoons olive oil', '2 ¼ cups all-purpose flour, divided', '1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt', '4 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, shredded', '4 ounces low-moisture mozzarella cheese, shredded', '8 ounces feta cheese, crumbled', '2 large eggs', '1 tablespoon butter, cut into 4 pats', 'sea salt to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine milk, water, sugar, and yeast in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add olive oil, 2 cups flour, and salt.
', 'Step 4: Mix until a sticky dough comes together.
', 'Step 5: Turn dough out onto a floured surface.
', 'Step 6: Knead for about 3 minutes, adding in remaining flour as needed, until dough is very soft but still workable.
', 'Step 7: Form into a ball and place in a lightly oiled bowl.
', 'Step 8: Cover and let rise in a warm spot until doubled in volume, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 9: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Combine Monterey Jack, mozzarella, and feta cheeses in a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Toss together and refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 12: Punch down dough and turn out onto a floured surface.
', 'Step 13: Flatten slightly and cut in half.
', 'Step 14: Dust a large sheet of parchment paper with flour.
', 'Step 15: Place 1 dough half on top and roll out into a square about 1/8- to 1/4-inch thick, stretching out the corners as needed.
', 'Step 16: Arrange 1/4 of the cheese in 2 rows, 1 to 2 inches from the longest sides.
', 'Step 17: Roll sides up tightly over the cheese, forming a canoe shape around the dough.
', 'Step 18: Pinch and twist ends to seal.
', 'Step 19: Cut off excess parchment around the dough; lift dough onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 20: Repeat shaping and stuffing the other dough half.
', 'Step 21: Fill the canoe with the remaining cheese mixture.
', 'Step 22: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 23: Form a well in the center of each khachapuri using a spoon; crack an egg inside each well.
', 'Step 24: Return to oven and bake until eggs are mostly set, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Place 2 pats of butter over each filling and sprinkle salt and cayenne on top.
', 'Step 26: Plate khachapuri; tear off one end and use it to stir the butter into the egg.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '692.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '60.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '196.9 mg', 'fatContent': '34.3 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '34 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '20.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '1983.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.2 g'}

Title: Chef John's Falafel
Ingredients: ['1 cup dry garbanzo beans', '½ yellow onion, diced', '½ cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', '4 cloves minced garlic', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, or more as needed', '2 teaspoons lemon juice', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon baking soda', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place garbanzo beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 12 to 24 hours.
', 'Step 2: Drain.
', 'Step 3: Blend garbanzo beans, onion, parsley, garlic, flour, lemon juice, salt, cumin, coriander, baking soda, and cayenne pepper together in a food processor, scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary, until mixture is finely ground and holds together when pressed.
', 'Step 4: Transfer garbanzo mixture to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until flavors blend, 1 to 2 hours.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Divide dough into 12 portions and roll each with moistened hands into a ball.
', 'Step 7: Working in batches, cook falafel balls in hot oil until browned and crispy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Transfer to a wire rack to drain.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '270.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '24.4 g', 'fatContent': '16.9 g', 'fiberContent': '6.5 g', 'proteinContent': '7.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '646.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.5 g'}

Title: Turkish Red Lentil Soup with Mint
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '½ onion, diced', '1 clove garlic, minced', '¼ cup diced tomatoes, drained', '5 cups chicken stock', '½ cup red lentils', '¼ cup fine bulgur', '¼ cup rice', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon dried mint', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir the onion in the hot oil until it begins to soften, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir the garlic into the onion and cook another 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add the diced tomatoes to the onion mixture; continue to cook and stir another 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour in the chicken stock, red lentils, bulgur, rice, tomato paste, paprika, cayenne pepper, and mint to the tomato mixture; season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 6: Bring the soup to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until the the lentils and rice are cooked through, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Pour the soup into a blender to no more than half full.
', 'Step 8: Firmly hold the lid in place and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree.
', 'Step 9: Puree in batches until smooth; pour into your serving dish.
', 'Step 10: Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup in cooking pot.
']

Title: Slow Cooker Moroccan Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 2 inch pieces', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '3 fresh peaches - peeled, pitted, and sliced', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '1 cup chopped dried apricots', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 tablespoon cornstarch', '1 tablespoon water', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '⅓ cup slivered almonds, toasted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken in the bottom of a slow cooker.
', 'Step 2: Add the garlic, onion, tomatoes, peaches, garbanzo beans, dried apricots, cumin, ginger, cinnamon, coriander, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 3: Pour in the chicken broth.
', 'Step 4: Cook on Low for 5 hours.
', 'Step 5: Remove the chicken and keep warm.
', 'Step 6: Mix the cornstarch and water in a small bowl.
', 'Step 7: Stir the cornstarch mixture into the slow cooker.
', 'Step 8: Cook on High until the sauce has thickened, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Return the chicken to the slow cooker and heat through.
', 'Step 10: Top with fresh cilantro and almonds before serving.
']

Title: Arabic Fattoush Salad
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil for frying', '2 small (4 inch) pita breads, torn into pieces', '1 large English cucumber, finely diced', '3 cups halved grape tomatoes', '½ red onion, finely diced', '¾ cup chopped Italian parsley', '¾ cup chopped fresh mint', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, or to taste', '1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground sumac, or to taste', '1 clove garlic, crushed (or more to taste)', 'kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', "1 ounce sheep's milk feta cheese"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Place pita pieces into the skillet without crowding.
', 'Step 3: Fry in batches until golden brown and blot dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 4: Combine cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, parsley, mint, olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, garlic, salt, and ground black pepper in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: Gently toss salad with fried pita pieces.
', 'Step 6: Grate feta cheese on top using a small cheese grater.
']

Title: Peppy's Pita Bread
Ingredients: ['1 ⅛ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)', '3 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 ½ teaspoons white sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons active dry yeast']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place all ingredients in bread pan of your bread machine, select Dough setting and start.
', 'Step 2: When dough has risen long enough, machine will beep.
', 'Step 3: Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface.
', 'Step 4: Gently roll and stretch dough into a 12 inch rope.
', 'Step 5: With a sharp knife, divide dough into 8 pieces.
', 'Step 6: Roll each into a smooth ball.
', 'Step 7: With a rolling pin, roll each ball into a 6 to 7 inch circle.
', 'Step 8: Set aside on a lightly floured countertop.
', 'Step 9: cover with a towel.
', 'Step 10: Let pitas rise about 30 minutes until slightly puffy.
', 'Step 11: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Place 2 or 3 pitas on a wire cake rack.
', 'Step 13: Place cake rack directly on oven rack.
', 'Step 14: Bake pitas 4 to 5 minutes until puffed and tops begin to brown.
', 'Step 15: Remove from oven and immediately place pitas in a sealed brown paper bag or cover them with a damp kitchen towel until soft.
', 'Step 16: Once pitas a softened, either cut in half or split top edge for half or whole pitas.
', 'Step 17: They can be stored in a plastic bag in the refrigerator for several days or in the freezer for 1 or 2 months.
']

Title: Chicken Curry and Potatoes
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) chicken, cut into pieces', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 medium (2-1/2" dia)s onions, chopped', '8 cloves garlic, chopped', '¼ cup mild curry powder', '2 tablespoons hot curry powder', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 pinch salt to taste', '5 medium (2-1/4" to 3" dia, raw)s russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken into a large saucepan and cover with water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to medium and simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic until onion is tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir mild curry powder, hot curry powder, black pepper, and salt into onion mixture; continue to cook and stir for 5 minutes, then transfer mixture to chicken and broth.
', 'Step 5: Stir potatoes into chicken mixture.
', 'Step 6: Simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes more.
']

Title: Bazlama - Turkish Flat Bread
Ingredients: ['1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 tablespoon salt', '1 ½ cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)', '½ cup Greek-style yogurt', '4 cups all-purpose flour']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Dissolve the yeast, sugar, and salt in the warm water.
', 'Step 2: Add the water and yogurt to the flour and mix well.
', 'Step 3: The dough will be soft but not sticky.
', 'Step 4: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and shape it into a ball.
', 'Step 5: Cover the dough with a damp cloth and allow it to rise at room temperature for 3 hours.
', 'Step 6: Cut the dough into four portions.
', "Step 7: Shape the dough into rounds and flatten each round as though you're making pizza dough.
", 'Step 8: Cover the rounds with a damp cloth and let the dough rest for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Heat a cast iron skillet or griddle over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Place one dough round in the skillet and bake until brown spots appear on the bottom, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Flip the bread and bake for an additional minute.
', 'Step 12: Remove the bread and wrap it in a clean kitchen towel to keep warm.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with the remaining dough rounds.
', 'Step 14: Store any leftover flatbreads in an airtight container.
']

Title: Hummus III
Ingredients: ['2 cups canned garbanzo beans, drained', '⅓ cup tahini', '¼ cup lemon juice', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 cloves garlic, halved', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 pinch paprika', '1 teaspoon minced fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the garbanzo beans, tahini, lemon juice, salt and garlic in a blender or food processor.
', 'Step 2: Blend until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Transfer mixture to a serving bowl.
', 'Step 4: Drizzle olive oil over the garbanzo bean mixture.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle with paprika and parsley.
']

Title: Chef John's Harissa Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 red bell peppers, halved and seeded', '6 Fresno chile peppers', '1 habanero pepper', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '¼ teaspoon caraway seeds, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon coriander seeds, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon dried mint', '1 teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste', '4 garlic cloves, peeled', '1 lemon, juiced', '1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat oven's broiler and set the oven rack at about 6 inches from the heat source.
", 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Place red bell peppers with cut sides down onto the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Place the blackened peppers into a bowl and tightly seal with plastic wrap.
', 'Step 6: Allow the peppers to steam as they cool, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove and discard skins.
', 'Step 8: n Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Add Fresno and habanero chiles and cook uncovered over medium heat until vegetables start to soften, about 3 minutes; drain and set aside to cool.
', 'Step 10: Remove seeds and membranes from chiles (wear gloves); set aside.
', 'Step 11: n Shake coriander and caraway seeds in a skillet over medium heat until you start to smell the spice, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Use a mortar and pestle to crush toasted seeds; add cumin, mint, and salt, and crush until finely ground.
', 'Step 13: Transfer spices to a blender and add roasted bell peppers, chiles, garlic, lemon juice, and vegetable oil; puree until smooth.
', 'Step 14: Drizzle in extra-virgin olive oil at the end, blending for only a few seconds.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '99.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '9.6 g', 'fatContent': '7.2 g', 'fiberContent': '2.5 g', 'proteinContent': '1.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '326.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.9 g'}

Title: Reshteh Polo (Persian Noodle Rice)
Ingredients: ['1 cup basmati rice', '3 ½ tablespoons kosher salt, divided', '¼ teaspoon saffron threads', '2 tablespoons boiling water', '½ (8 ounce) package roasted noodles', '¼ cup grapeseed oil', 'kosher salt to taste (such as Diamond Crystal®)', '2 medium gold potatoes, sliced into quarter rounds', '¼ cup boiling water', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter', '6 Medjool dates, pitted and quartered', '½ cup golden raisins, rinsed and drained', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place rice in a medium bowl and cover with tepid water.
', 'Step 2: Gently swish it around with your finger to activate the starches, then tip the bowl to drain water.
', 'Step 3: Repeat this process until water runs clear, about 7 rinses.
', 'Step 4: Cover rice with cold water, add 1/2 tablespoon salt, stir gently, and soak for 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Drain rice without rinsing.
', 'Step 6: Crush saffron threads to a powder in a small mortar and pestle.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a small bowl with 2 tablespoons boiling water.
', 'Step 8: Stir, cover, and set saffron water aside.
', 'Step 9: Fill a 5-quart nonstick pot with 9 cups water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Add 3 tablespoons salt and stir until dissolved.
', 'Step 11: Break roasted noodles into thirds and add to the boiling water with the rice.
', 'Step 12: Stir once gently, and watch carefully as it cooks so water does not boil over.
', 'Step 13: Taste water for salt and adjust accordingly.
', 'Step 14: Cook until the first rice grain pops up to the surface.
', 'Step 15: Set a timer for 4 minutes and cook, scooping off any foam from the surface, until the timer goes off.
', 'Step 16: Test rice and continue to cook until tender on the outside but still firm to the bite on the inside, 6 to 8 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Drain rice and noodles in a colander and rinse quickly with lukewarm water and a spray faucet to rinse off extra starch.
', 'Step 18: Taste and gently rinse again if too salty.
', 'Step 19: Set aside to drain completely.
', 'Step 20: Wash and dry the pot.
', 'Step 21: Place the clean pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 22: Add oil, 1 tablespoon saffron water, and a pinch of salt; swirl the pot until the bottom and lower sides are coated with the oil mixture.
', 'Step 23: Tightly overlap potato slices in a single layer covering the bottom of the pot to create the tahdig layer.
', 'Step 24: Gently scatter rice-noodle mixture over the tahdig in a pyramid shape, making sure potatoes are completely covered and moving noodles away from the sides of the pot.
', 'Step 25: Gently poke the handle of a wooden spoon into the rice and noodles a few times, being careful not to hit the tahdig; this will allow steam to escape while cooking.
', 'Step 26: Cover and cook until you see steam escaping from the sides of the lid and tahdig starts to set, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 27: Meanwhile, combine 1/4 cup boiling water with 2 tablespoons melted butter and remaining saffron water.
', 'Step 28: Lay a kitchen towel out on a heatproof surface.
', 'Step 29: Test the tahdig by quickly tapping the side of the pot with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 30: When the pot sizzles, remove it from the heat.
', 'Step 31: Remove the lid and place it on the kitchen towel, being careful that none of the condensation drips into the pot.
', 'Step 32: Wrap the towel around the lid and secure the ends at the top by the handle so they will not hang near the heat source.
', 'Step 33: Drizzle the butter mixture over the rice and cover with the towel-wrapped lid.
', 'Step 34: Place a heat diffuser on a burner over low or medium-low heat and return the pot to the stove.
', 'Step 35: Cook until crispy, rotating the pot a few times, about 35 minutes.
', 'Step 36: Remove from the heat and place on a damp kitchen towel; let sit, uncovered, for 5 minutes so tahdig will release easily.
', 'Step 37: Meanwhile, melt 3 tablespoons butter in a small pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 38: Add dates, raisins, and cinnamon; sprinkle with a little salt.
', 'Step 39: Cook and stir until dates are glistening and soft, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 40: Gently scatter rice on a platter and remove potato tahdig pieces and serve on the side.
', 'Step 41: Sprinkle raisin-date sauce over top.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '287.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '44.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '15.3 mg', 'fatContent': '11.7 g', 'fiberContent': '2.4 g', 'proteinContent': '3.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '2123.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '15.7 g'}

Title: Sabzi Polo (Green Herb Rice)
Ingredients: ['2 ½ cups long-grain basmati rice', 'kosher salt, divided', '¼ teaspoon saffron threads', '2 tablespoons boiling water', '1 large bunch finely chopped fresh parsley', '1 large bunch finely chopped fresh cilantro', '1 large bunch finely chopped fresh dill', '1 large bunch finely chopped fresh chives', '¼ cup dried dill, finely chopped', '¼ cup grapeseed oil', '1 sheet lavash bread, or as needed', '2 fresh spring garlic stalks', '¼ cup boiling water', '3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place rice in a medium bowl and cover with tepid water.
', 'Step 2: Gently swish it around with your finger to activate the starches, then tip the bowl to drain water.
', 'Step 3: Repeat this process until water runs clear, about 7 rinses.
', 'Step 4: Cover rice with cold water, add 1 tablespoon salt, stir gently, and soak for 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Drain rice without rinsing.
', 'Step 6: Crush saffron threads to a powder in a small mortar and pestle.
', 'Step 7: Transfer to a small bowl with 2 tablespoons boiling water.
', 'Step 8: Stir, cover, and set saffron water aside.
', 'Step 9: Fill a 5-quart nonstick pot with 12 cups water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 10: Add 4 tablespoons salt and stir until dissolved.
', 'Step 11: Add rice, stir once gently, and watch carefully as it cooks so water does not boil over.
', 'Step 12: Taste water for salt and adjust accordingly.
', 'Step 13: Cook rice until the first piece pops up to the surface.
', 'Step 14: Set a timer for 4 minutes and cook, scooping off any foam from the surface, until the timer goes off.
', 'Step 15: Test rice and continue to cook until tender on the outside but still firm to the bite on the inside, 6 to 8 minutes more.
', 'Step 16: Drain rice in a colander and rinse quickly with lukewarm water and a spray faucet to rinse off extra starch.
', 'Step 17: Taste rice and gently rinse again if too salty.
', 'Step 18: Set aside to drain completely.
', 'Step 19: Wash and dry the pot.
', 'Step 20: Combine chopped fresh parsley, cilantro, dill, and chives with dried dill in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 21: Gently combine herb mixture with rice in the colander, taking care not to break the grains of rice.
', 'Step 22: Place the clean pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 23: Add oil, 1 tablespoon saffron water, and a pinch of salt; swirl the pot until the bottom and lower sides are coated with the oil mixture.
', 'Step 24: Trim or tear lavash bread and cover the bottom of the pot to create the tahdig layer.
', 'Step 25: Gently scatter rice-herb mixture over the tahdig in a pyramid shape, making sure lavash is completely covered.
', 'Step 26: Place garlic stalks on top at the outer edges of the rice.
', 'Step 27: Gently poke the handle of a wooden spoon into the rice a few times, being careful not to hit the tahdig; this will allow steam to escape while cooking.
', 'Step 28: Cover and cook until you see steam escaping from the sides of the lid and tahdig starts to set, 10 to 13 minutes.
', 'Step 29: Meanwhile, combine 1/4 cup boiling water with melted butter and remaining saffron water.
', 'Step 30: Lay a kitchen towel out on a heatproof surface.
', 'Step 31: Test the tahdig by quickly tapping the side of the pot with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 32: When the pot sizzles, remove it from the heat.
', 'Step 33: Remove the lid and place it on the kitchen towel, being careful that none of the condensation drips into the pot.
', 'Step 34: Wrap the towel around the lid and secure the ends at the top by the handle so they will not hang near the heat source.
', 'Step 35: Drizzle the butter mixture over the rice and cover with the towel-wrapped lid.
', 'Step 36: Place a heat diffuser on a burner over low or medium-low heat and return the pot to the stove.
', 'Step 37: Cook until crispy, rotating the pot a few times, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 38: Remove from the heat and place on a damp kitchen towel; let sit, uncovered, for 5 minutes so tahdig will release easily.
', 'Step 39: Serve the rice on a platter, garnish with garlic stalks, and remove the tahdig whole or in pieces and serve on the side.
', 'Step 40: Or, invert carefully but quickly (like a cake) onto a serving platter.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '286.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '45 g', 'cholesterolContent': '9.2 mg', 'fatContent': '10 g', 'fiberContent': '1.9 g', 'proteinContent': '5.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '2942.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.6 g'}

Title: Chef John's Baklava
Ingredients: ['2 ½ cups walnut halves', '1 cup shelled pistachios', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon', '½ cup unsalted butter, melted', '12 sheets phyllo dough, thawed if frozen', '1 ½ cups sugar', '¾ cup water', '¼ cup honey', '3 whole cloves', '¼ teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 ½ teaspoons orange flower water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place walnuts, pistachios, and cinnamon in bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 2: Pulse on and off until mixture is chopped but not too fine.
', 'Step 3: Brush bottom of 9-inch round baking pan with melted butter.
', 'Step 4: Place one round of phyllo dough in the pan; add a second round of dough.
', 'Step 5: Drip about 1 tablespoon of melted butter over the top.
', 'Step 6: Add 2 more sheets and drizzle with butter.
', 'Step 7: Add 2 more sheets and drip with butter creating 6 layers for the bottom.
', 'Step 8: (While you work keep the phyllo sheets covered with a damp, nearly dry, cotton towel to keep dough from drying out.
', 'Step 9: ) Sprinkle with 1/3 of the nut mixture.
', 'Step 10: Top with a sheet of phyllo and drip with melted butter; repeat with 1 more sheet of filo.
', 'Step 11: Add another 1/3 of the nut mixture.
', 'Step 12: Place another sheet of phyllo on the nuts; drip with butter.
', 'Step 13: Top with another sheet and drip with butter.
', 'Step 14: Add the remaining nut mixture.
', 'Step 15: Top with 2 sheets of phyllo; drip with butter.
', 'Step 16: Add 2 more sheets; drip with butter.
', 'Step 17: Top with the last 2 sheets and drizzle generously with the remaining butter.
', 'Step 18: Cover pan with plastic and refrigerate until completely chilled, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 19: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 20: Cut baklava into about 12 diamond-shaped pieces approximately the same size.
', 'Step 21: Bake in preheated oven until browned and crisp, about an hour.
', 'Step 22: Place sugar, honey, and cloves in a saucepan.
', 'Step 23: Pour in water.
', 'Step 24: Place pan over medium-high heat and whisk to combine.
', 'Step 25: Bring to a boil; remove from heat.
', 'Step 26: Whisk in vanilla and orange blossom water.
', 'Step 27: After baklava has rested 5 minutes, ladle syrup over the top.
', 'Step 28: Cool down to room temperature before serving.
']

Title: Lentils and Rice with Fried Onions (Mujadarrah)
Ingredients: ['6 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large white onion, sliced into rings', '1 ⅓ cups uncooked green lentils', '¾ cup uncooked long-grain white rice', 'salt and pepper to taste', '¼ cup plain yogurt or sour cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the onions, and cook about 10 minutes, until browned.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat, and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Place lentils in a medium saucepan with enough lightly salted water to cover.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir rice and enough water to cover into the saucepan with the lentils.
', 'Step 7: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Cover saucepan, and continue to simmer 15 to 20 minutes, until rice and lentils are tender.
', 'Step 9: Mix half the onions into the lentil mixture.
', 'Step 10: Top with yogurt or sour cream and remaining onions to serve.
']

Title: Ma'amoul (Lebanese Date Cookies)
Ingredients: ['2 cups semolina flour', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '½ teaspoon ground mahlab', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 cup clarified butter, at room temperature', '5 tablespoons milk', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon active dry yeast', '4 tablespoons orange blossom water, or more as needed', '10 tablespoons date paste (such as Ziyad®), cut into small pieces', '2 tablespoons powdered sugar, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix semolina flour, all-purpose flour, mahlab, and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Work clarified butter into the dry ingredients with your fingertips until thoroughly incorporated.
', 'Step 3: Cover bowl and let dough rest at room temperature, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Pour milk into a microwave-safe bowl.
', 'Step 5: Microwave until just warm, about 15 seconds.
', 'Step 6: Stir in sugar and yeast until dissolved.
', 'Step 7: Let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Pour yeast mixture and orange blossom water over the dough and mix until evenly moistened.
', 'Step 9: Pinch off a piece of dough and roll into a ball; it should hold its shape without cracking.
', 'Step 10: Add more milk or orange blossom water if needed.
', 'Step 11: Cover and let rest for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.
', "Step 14: Sprinkle some flour over the ma'amoul molds and tap out the excess.
", 'Step 15: Pinch off a walnut-sized piece of dough and roll into a ball.
', 'Step 16: Press your thumb into the ball to create space for the filling.
', 'Step 17: Work the edges with your fingers so the sides are even and fairly thin.
', 'Step 18: Drop in a piece of date paste and pinch dough over it to seal.
', 'Step 19: Place cookie into the mold cavity seam-side up.
', 'Step 20: Press down so that the top is flush with edges of the mold.
', 'Step 21: Trim off any excess dough.
', 'Step 22: Invert the mold and tap it against your work surface to release the cookie.
', 'Step 23: Repeat with remaining dough and date paste, arranging cookies 1 inch apart on the baking sheets.
', 'Step 24: Bake in the preheated oven, 1 baking sheet at a time, until edges and bottoms are golden but tops are still mostly pale, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Sift powdered sugar over the cookies while still slightly warm.
', 'Step 26: Let cool completely.
', 'Step 27: Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '56.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '4.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '11.1 mg', 'fatContent': '4.3 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '0.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '25.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.1 g'}

Title: Turkey Kofta Kabobs
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground turkey', '1 small onion, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 egg', '¼ teaspoon chopped green chile pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground paprika', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', 'salt to taste']

['Step 1: Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 2: Combine ground turkey, onion, garlic, cilantro, egg, chile pepper, coriander, paprika, chili powder, and salt together in a large bowl; mix thoroughly.

', 'Step 5: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: The Rebbetzin Chef's Persian Walnut Cookies

Title: Chakchouka (Shakshouka)

Title: Easy Lamb Shawarma
Ingredients: ['2 cups plain yogurt', '¼ cup distilled white vinegar', '¼ cup olive oil', '3 tablespoons lemon juice', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '2 bay leaf', '3 ½ pounds boneless leg of lamb, trimmed of fat, and cut into thin strips', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '8 (8 inch) pita bread rounds', '2 tomatoes, thinly sliced', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '½ bunch fresh mint leaves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk together the yogurt, vinegar, 1/4 cup of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cinnamon, nutmeg, oregano, and bay leaf in a bowl, and pour into a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Add the thinly sliced lamb, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator 6 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Pour in the meat and marinade, and cook until the lamb is no longer pink, and is tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir frequently as the meat cooks.
', 'Step 7: Divide the cooked lamb meat among the warmed pita breads, and garnish with tomatoes, onion, and fresh mint leaves to serve.
']

Title: Kanafa
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) box shredded phyllo dough (kataifi)', '1 (15 ounce) container ricotta cheese', '1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese', '⅓ cup white sugar', '12 ounces unsalted butter', '1 cup white sugar', '½ cup water', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '⅛ teaspoon rose water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Use a food processor to finely chop the frozen, shredded phyllo dough.
', 'Step 3: The strands should be about the size of a grain of rice.
', 'Step 4: Pour the dough into a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 5: In a separate bowl, mix together the ricotta, mozzarella, and 1/3 cup sugar.
', 'Step 6: Place the butter in a large liquid measuring cup or bowl with a spout.
', 'Step 7: Heat the butter in a microwave until completely melted, and let it sit for several minutes until a thick white foam has formed on top.
', 'Step 8: Clarify the butter by using a spoon to skim off the foam.
', 'Step 9: Carefully pour the butter into the bowl of phyllo dough.
', 'Step 10: Avoid pouring in the white milk solids at the bottom of the clarified butter.
', 'Step 11: Use your hands to mix the butter and dough together.
', 'Step 12: Make sure that the butter is absorbed by taking handfuls of the dough and rubbing it between your palms.
', 'Step 13: Evenly spread the buttered phyllo dough into a 9x13-inch pan and firmly press it into the bottom and edges.
', 'Step 14: Spread the cheese mixture onto the dough, avoiding the edges of the pan.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is slightly golden and the edges of dough are brown and bubbly, 30 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 16: While the kanafa is baking, prepare the syrup.
', 'Step 17: Combine the water and 1/2 cup sugar in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 18: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 19: Reduce the heat to medium and stir in the lemon juice.
', 'Step 20: Simmer, stirring constantly, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is thickened, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 21: (Do not let the mixture turn golden and caramelize.
', 'Step 22: ) Remove from heat and add the rose water; set aside.
', 'Step 23: Remove the kanafa from the oven.
', 'Step 24: Place a large platter or baking sheet over the baking dish.
', 'Step 25: Using oven mitts, carefully invert the baking dish onto the platter so the phyllo is on top.
', 'Step 26: Pour the syrup over the kanafa.
', 'Step 27: Cut into pieces and serve while hot.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '663.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '59.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '115.8 mg', 'fatContent': '42.1 g', 'proteinContent': '12.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '25.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '277.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '33.7 g'}

Title: Sean's Falafel and Cucumber Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 (6 ounce) container plain yogurt', '½ cucumber - peeled, seeded, and finely chopped', '1 teaspoon dried dill weed', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon mayonnaise', '1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained', '1 onion, chopped', '½ cup fresh parsley', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 egg', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 dash pepper', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 cup dry bread crumbs', 'oil for frying', '2 pita breads, cut in half', '1 cup chopped tomatoes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a small bowl combine yogurt, cucumber, dill, salt, pepper and mayonnaise and mix well.
', 'Step 2: Chill for at least 30 minutes.
', "Step 3: In a large bowl mash chickpeas until thick and pasty; don't use a blender, as the consistency will be too thin.
", 'Step 4: In a blender, process onion, parsley and garlic until smooth.
', 'Step 5: Stir into mashed chickpeas.
', 'Step 6: In a small bowl combine egg, cumin, coriander, salt, pepper, cayenne, lemon juice and baking powder.
', 'Step 7: Stir into chickpea mixture along with olive oil.
', 'Step 8: Slowly add bread crumbs until mixture is not sticky but will hold together; add more or less bread crumbs, as needed.
', 'Step 9: Form 8 balls and then flatten into patties.
', 'Step 10: Heat 1 inch of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 11: Fry patties in hot oil until brown on both sides.
', 'Step 12: Serve two falafels in each pita half topped with chopped tomatoes and cucumber sauce.
']

Title: Turkish Eggs (Cilbir)
Ingredients: ['1 cup Greek yogurt, at room temperature', '1 clove garlic', '¼ teaspoon salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '2 ½ tablespoons finely chopped fresh dill, or to taste', '½ stick unsalted butter', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon smoked paprika', '1 tablespoon Aleppo chili flakes', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley', '1 tablespoon diced jalapeno pepper', '1 pinch salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon white vinegar, or as needed', '4 large eggs', '1 pinch sea salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Spoon yogurt into a medium bowl.
', 'Step 2: Grate in garlic and mix to combine.
', 'Step 3: Season with salt, pepper, and cayenne.
', 'Step 4: Add dill and mix thoroughly.
', 'Step 5: Set aside at room temperature.
', 'Step 6: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; heat until bubbles begin to burst.
', 'Step 7: Add cumin, paprika, and chili flakes.
', 'Step 8: Stir until color is uniform, then turn off heat and let spices infuse.
', 'Step 9: Grind parsley and jalapeno together in a mortar.
', 'Step 10: Season with salt, drizzle in olive oil, and stir to combine.
', 'Step 11: Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to medium-low, pour in vinegar, and keep the water at a gentle simmer.
', 'Step 13: Crack an egg into a small bowl then gently slip egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl just above the surface of water.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with the remaining eggs.
', 'Step 15: Cook eggs until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove the eggs from the water with a slotted spoon, dab on a kitchen towel to remove excess water, and place onto a warm plate.
', 'Step 17: Dollop yogurt mixture onto serving plates.
', 'Step 18: Use the back of a spoon to spread yogurt out into a bed for the eggs, carving ridges into the top to catch the oil.
', 'Step 19: Drizzle on some jalapeno oil.
', 'Step 20: Top with eggs and a spoonful or two of the Aleppo butter.
', 'Step 21: Sprinkle sea salt on top.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '615.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '8.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '455.5 mg', 'fatContent': '57.1 g', 'fiberContent': '2 g', 'proteinContent': '19.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '24.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '742.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.3 g'}

Title: Baked Chicken Shawarma
Ingredients: ['⅔ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '2 medium lemons, juiced', '1 tablespoon lemon zest', '4 tablespoons finely minced fresh garlic', '4 teaspoons smoked paprika', '4 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons ground coriander', '2 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste', '2 teaspoons salt, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs', '1 large onions, sliced 1/2-inch thick', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine olive oil, lemon juice and zest, garlic, smoked paprika, ground cumin, ground coriander, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, turmeric, and cinnamon in a gallon-sized resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 2: Seal the bag and gently squeeze ingredients together until they are well blended.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken thighs to the bag, squeeze out most of the air, seal, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or up to 8 hours.
', 'Step 4: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Lightly grease a 12x18-inch baking sheet.
', 'Step 6: Spread onion slices over the bottom; add chicken thighs on top.
', 'Step 7: Bake on the center rack of the preheated oven, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Switch on the broiler and move rack closer to the broiler.
', 'Step 9: Broil chicken until a light char develops, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 10: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Garnish with parsley.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '478.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '106 mg', 'fatContent': '37.1 g', 'fiberContent': '2.7 g', 'proteinContent': '29.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '682.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '1 g'}

Title: Shirazi Salad
Ingredients: ['4 medium firm Roma tomatoes, finely diced', '1 medium English cucumber, finely diced', '½ cup diced red onion', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon dried mint', '¼ cup freshly squeezed lime juice', '3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon sumac', '1 sprig fresh mint']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine tomatoes, English cucumber, onion, and cilantro in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Sprinkle with mint and transfer to the refrigerator for flavors to meld, at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and sumac in a small bowl until well combined.
', 'Step 4: Drizzle dressing over the salad right before serving.
', 'Step 5: Toss well to combine, and garnish with fresh mint leaves.
']

Title: Turkish Chicken Kebabs
Ingredients: ['1 cup whole-milk Greek yogurt', '2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons ketchup', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon Aleppo red pepper flakes', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '⅛ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '2 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, halved', '4 long metal skewers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, ketchup, garlic, red pepper flakes, salt, cumin, black pepper, paprika, and cinnamon together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Place chicken thigh halves into the yogurt marinade and coat them thoroughly on all sides.
', 'Step 3: Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate 2 to 8 hours.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Using 2 skewers for each kebab, thread half of the chicken thighs onto each pair of skewers making a fairly thick "log" shape.
', 'Step 6: Place kebabs on grill.
', 'Step 7: Do not try to turn them until they begin to unstick from the grill, 3 or 4 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Turn kebabs and grill the other side 3 or 4 minutes; turn.
', 'Step 9: Continue cooking and turning until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 10: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
']

Title: Pita Chips
Ingredients: ['12 pita bread pockets', '½ cup olive oil', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon garlic salt', '½ teaspoon dried basil', '1 teaspoon dried chervil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Cut each pita bread into 8 triangles.
', 'Step 3: Place triangles on lined cookie sheet.
', 'Step 4: In a small bowl, combine the oil, pepper, salt, basil and chervil.
', 'Step 5: Brush each triangle with oil mixture.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for about 7 minutes, or until lightly browned and crispy.
', 'Step 7: Watch carefully, as they tend to burn easily!
']

Title: Ghormeh Sabzi (Persian Herb Stew)
Ingredients: ['¼ cup canola oil, divided', '1 large yellow onion, finely chopped', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 ½ pounds boneless chuck roast, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', '1 ½ cups finely chopped spinach', '1 cup finely chopped green onions (green part only)', '½ cup finely chopped Italian flat-leaf parsley', '¼ cup finely chopped cilantro', '¼ cup finely chopped chives', '¼ cup finely chopped fenugreek leaves', '1 ½ cups water, or more as needed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 lemon, juiced', '4 dried Persian limes (limoo amani), or more to taste', '1 (15 ounce) can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion; cook and stir until deep golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in turmeric for 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add chuck cubes; cook until coated in turmeric and browned on all sides, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a separate pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Add spinach, green onions, parsley, cilantro, chives, and fenugreek leaves; cook and stir until deep dark green in color, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir spinach mixture into the onion and chuck mixture.
', 'Step 8: Pour in enough water to create a slurry consistency.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Pour in lemon juice.
', 'Step 11: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer stew until greens soften, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 12: Pierce dried limes with a fork and add to the stew.
', 'Step 13: Continue simmering until chuck is tender, 30 minutes to 1 hour.
', 'Step 14: Stir in red kidney beans.
', 'Step 15: Cook until flavors combine, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Discard dried limes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '343.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '51.5 mg', 'fatContent': '22.6 g', 'fiberContent': '7.5 g', 'proteinContent': '18.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '226 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.7 g'}

Title: Persian Rice
Ingredients: ['3 quarts water', '3 tablespoons kosher salt', '2 cups basmati rice, rinsed', '1 pinch ground cumin', 'salt to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 russet potato, cut into 1/4-inch slices', '3 tablespoons butter, cut into thin slices, or to taste', '1 pinch saffron threads', '1 ½ tablespoons hot water', '1 tablespoon chopped parsley, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring water and kosher salt to a boil in a pot; add rice and cook, stirring, for exactly 7 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cover bottom of pot with 1 layer of potato slices.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle cumin and salt over potatoes.
', 'Step 6: Cook until potatoes are sizzling, 2 to 3 minutes; top potatoes with rice to form an even layer.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to low and place butter slices over rice.
', 'Step 8: Top pot with a layer of clean paper towels and place lid over towels.
', 'Step 9: Steam until rice is fluffy, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Grind saffron threads with a mortar and pestle.
', 'Step 11: Mix crushed saffron with 1 1/2 tablespoons hot water in a large bowl.
', 'Step 12: Add a couple spoonfuls of rice to saffron mixture and stir until rice is yellow.
', 'Step 13: Spoon remaining rice into a serving bowl, top with saffron rice, and line edges of bowl with potatoes.
', 'Step 14: Garnish with parsley.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '254.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '41.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '11.4 mg', 'fatContent': '8.3 g', 'fiberContent': '0.9 g', 'proteinContent': '4.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '2223.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.3 g'}

Title: Easy Baklava
Ingredients: ['1 pound chopped nuts', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 (16 ounce) package phyllo dough', '1 cup butter, melted', '1 cup white sugar', '1 cup water', '½ cup honey', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 teaspoon grated lemon zest']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Toss together cinnamon and nuts.
', 'Step 4: Unroll phyllo and cut whole stack in half to fit the dish.
', 'Step 5: Cover phyllo with a damp cloth while assembling the baklava, to keep it from drying out.
', 'Step 6: Place two sheets of phyllo in the bottom of the prepared dish.
', 'Step 7: Brush generously with butter.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle 2 to 3 tablespoons of the nut mixture on top.
', 'Step 9: Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with about 6 sheets of phyllo.
', 'Step 10: Using a sharp knife, cut baklava (all the way through to the bottom of the dish) into four long rows, then (nine times) diagonally to make 36 diamond shapes.
', 'Step 11: Bake in preheated oven until golden brown and crisp, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 12: While baklava is baking, combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 13: Stir in honey, vanilla and lemon or orange zest; reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Remove the baklava from the oven and immediately spoon the syrup over it.
', 'Step 15: Let cool completely before serving.
', 'Step 16: Store uncovered.
']

Title: Kofta Kebabs
Ingredients: ['4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 pound ground lamb', '3 tablespoons grated onion', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 tablespoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ tablespoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground allspice', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '28 bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Mash the garlic into a paste with the salt using a mortar and pestle or the flat side of a chef's knife on your cutting board.
", 'Step 2: Mix the garlic into the lamb along with the onion, parsley, coriander, cumin, cinnamon, allspice, cayenne pepper, ginger, and pepper in a mixing bowl until well blended.
', 'Step 3: Form the mixture into 28 balls.
', 'Step 4: Form each ball around the tip of a skewer, flattening into a 2 inch oval; repeat with the remaining skewers.
', 'Step 5: Place the kebabs onto a baking sheet, cover, and refrigerate at least 30 minutes, or up to 12 hours.
', 'Step 6: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil grate.
', 'Step 7: Cook the skewers on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until the lamb has cooked to your desired degree of doneness, about 6 minutes for medium.
']

Title: Extra Easy Hummus
Ingredients: ['1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained, liquid reserved', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon olive oil']
Cooking Instructions: ['Step 1: In a blender or food processor combine garbanzo beans, garlic, cumin, salt and olive oil.\n', 'Step 2: Blend on low speed, gradually adding reserved bean liquid, until desired consistency is achieved.\n']

Title: Easiest Falafel
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '¼ cup panko bread crumbs, or as needed', '¼ cup chopped onion', '¼ cup olive oil', '1 egg', '2 tablespoons dried parsley', '1 tablespoon curry powder', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '½ tablespoon ground black pepper', '¼ cup panko bread crumbs, or as needed', '1 cup olive oil for frying, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place garbanzo beans, 1/4 cup panko bread crumbs, onion, 1/4 cup olive oil, egg, parsley, curry powder, garlic powder, lemon juice, and black pepper in a food processor or blender.
', 'Step 2: Puree until coarse crumbles form.
', 'Step 3: Blend more panko crumbs into mixture if it is too moist.
', 'Step 4: Roll mixture into balls about the size of a golf ball; place on a plate.
', 'Step 5: Press into patties and coat in panko bread crumbs.
', 'Step 6: Heat about 1-inch olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Pan-fry patties until crispy, about 3 minutes on each side.
']

Title: Al Kabsa - Traditional Saudi Rice and Chicken
Ingredients: ['½ teaspoon saffron', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground allspice', '¼ teaspoon ground white pepper', '½ teaspoon dried whole lime powder', '¼ cup butter', '1 onion, finely chopped', '6 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces', '¼ cup tomato puree', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained', '3 carrots, peeled and grated', '2 whole cloves', '1 pinch ground nutmeg', '1 pinch ground cumin', '1 pinch ground coriander', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '3 ¼ cups hot water', '1 cube chicken bouillon', '2 ¼ cups unrinsed basmati rice', '¼ cup raisins', '¼ cup toasted slivered almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix together the saffron, cardamom, cinnamon, allspice, white pepper, and lime powder in a small bowl, and set the spice mix aside.
', 'Step 2: Melt the butter in a large stock pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the garlic and onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add the chicken pieces and brown them over medium-high heat until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix in the tomato puree.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the canned tomatoes with their juice, the grated carrots, whole cloves, nutmeg, cumin, coriander, salt, black pepper, and the Kabsa spice mix.
', 'Step 7: Cook for about 3 minutes; pour in the water, and add the chicken bouillon cube.
', 'Step 8: Bring the sauce to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer and cover the pot.
', 'Step 9: Simmer until chicken is no longer pink and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Gently stir in the rice.
', 'Step 11: Cover the pot and simmer until rice is tender and almost dry, about 25 minutes; add the raisins and a little more hot water, if necessary.
', 'Step 12: Cover and cook for an additional 5 to 10 minutes or until the rice grains are separate.
', 'Step 13: Transfer the rice to a large serving platter and arrange the chicken pieces on top.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle the toasted slivered almonds over the dish.
']

Title: Middle Eastern Rice with Black Beans and Chickpeas
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 cup uncooked basmati rice', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 quart chicken stock', '1 ½ pounds ground turkey', '2 (15 ounce) cans garbanzo beans (chickpeas), drained and rinsed', '2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed', '1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro', '1 bunch chopped fresh parsley', '¼ cup pine nuts', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in garlic, and cook 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Stir in rice, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir 5 minutes, then pour in chicken stock.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Place the turkey in a skillet over medium heat, and cook until evenly brown.
', 'Step 8: Gently mix cooked turkey, garbanzo beans, black beans, cilantro, parsley, and pine nuts into the cooked rice.
', 'Step 9: Season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Homemade Manti (Traditional Turkish Dumplings)
Ingredients: ['2 cups flour', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 eggs', '½ teaspoon water, or as needed', '2 onions, peeled', '½ pound ground beef', 'salt and pepper to taste', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon red pepper flakes', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 (8 ounce) container plain yogurt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the flour and salt in a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add the eggs and water, mixing well with your hands.
', 'Step 3: Add more water, if needed, to form a soft dough.
', 'Step 4: Cover and set aside for at least 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Shred the onions and place them in a colander or sieve set over a bowl; drain the juice and discard.
', 'Step 6: Combine the onion, ground beef, salt, and pepper; mix the meat well with a spoon until mashed.
', 'Step 7: Divide the dough into two portions and lightly flour a work surface.
', 'Step 8: Keep one piece of dough covered while you roll out the second portion into a rectangle, rolling the dough as thin as you can.
', 'Step 9: Cut the rectangle into 2-inch squares with a knife or pastry wheel.
', 'Step 10: Place about 2 teaspoons of the meat filling in the center of each square.
', 'Step 11: Seal the dumplings by gathering the edges of the dough and pinching them together at the top to form a bundle.
', 'Step 12: Transfer the finished manti to a floured plate, and sprinkle more flour over the manti to prevent sticking.
', 'Step 13: Repeat with the second piece of dough.
', "Step 14: Heat the oil and red pepper flakes in a small skillet over low heat just until the pepper flakes have started to color the oil; don't let them burn.
", 'Step 15: Remove from the heat and keep warm.
', 'Step 16: Stir the minced garlic into the yogurt and set aside.
', 'Step 17: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat, and cook the manti until the filling is no longer pink, and the dough is tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Drain well.
', 'Step 19: Divide the manti among four plates.
', 'Step 20: Spoon the yogurt sauce over the manti and drizzle each serving with the hot pepper oil.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '560.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '64.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '120 mg', 'fatContent': '23.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4.3 g', 'proteinContent': '23.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '439.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '9.4 g'}

Title: Umm Ali
Ingredients: ['1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed', '5 cups milk', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '¼ cup raisins', '¼ cup slivered almonds', '¼ cup pine nuts', '¼ cup chopped pistachio nuts', '¼ cup sweetened, flaked coconut']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Unroll the puff pastry sheets, and place flat on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until puffed and golden brown.
', 'Step 4: Break the puff pastry into pieces, and place in a large bowl.
', 'Step 5: Add the raisins, almonds, pine nuts, pistachios, and coconut, and toss to distribute.
', 'Step 6: Pour into a 9x13 inch glass baking dish, and spread evenly.
', 'Step 7: Pour the milk into a saucepan, and stir in the sugar and vanilla.
', 'Step 8: Heat until hot but not quite boiling.
', 'Step 9: Pour over the mixture in the baking dish.
', 'Step 10: Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 11: Turn the oven to broil, and broil for 2 minutes to brown the top.
', 'Step 12: Remove from the oven and let stand for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Serve warm.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '604.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '67.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '12.2 mg', 'fatContent': '32.7 g', 'fiberContent': '2.3 g', 'proteinContent': '12.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9 g', 'sodiumContent': '237.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '37.1 g'}

Title: Lebanese Mountain Bread
Ingredients: ['½ cup bread flour', '1 teaspoon active dry yeast', '1 teaspoon white sugar', '½ cup warm water', '¾ teaspoon kosher salt', '1 tablespoon olive oil, plus extra to coat bowl', '1 cup bread flour, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place 1/2 cup flour, yeast, and sugar in a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Pour in warm water.
', 'Step 3: Whisk together thoroughly, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Cover bowl and let sit until mixture gets bubbly, 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drizzle in olive oil; add salt and 1 cup flour.
', 'Step 6: Mix together until mixture forms a sticky (not wet) dough ball that pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
', 'Step 7: If mixture seems too wet, add a bit more flour.
', 'Step 8: Lightly flour a work surface.
', 'Step 9: Knead dough until it is soft, supple, and slightly elastic, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Pour a few drops of olive oil in a bowl.
', 'Step 11: Transfer dough ball to bowl and turn to coat surface with oil.
', 'Step 12: Cover bowl and place in a warm spot.
', 'Step 13: Let dough rise until it has doubled in size, 60 to 90 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Transfer dough to work surface and knead to remove air bubbles, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 15: Transfer to zip top plastic bag; refrigerate 8 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 16: Lightly flour a work surface; dough may be sticky so make sure you use enough flour to keep dough from sticking to the surface or your hands (but less flour is best).
', 'Step 17: Break off a piece of dough slightly smaller than a golf ball.
', 'Step 18: Roll into a smooth ball.
', 'Step 19: Flatten and roll out into a circle about 1/8-inch thick.
', 'Step 20: Invert a smooth mixing bowl on work surface; lightly flour the bottom.
', 'Step 21: Lightly stretch the dough and place dough circle on the floured surface of the inverted bowl.
', 'Step 22: Gently stretch dough evenly down the sides of the bowl, working your way around the edges, until it is very thin and translucent, or as thin as you can get it without tearing it.
', 'Step 23: Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat.
', 'Step 24: Flour your hands and carefully remove dough circle from bottom of bowl.
', 'Step 25: Transfer to hot skillet.
', 'Step 26: Cook until blisters form and begin to brown, about 45 to 60 seconds per side.
', 'Step 27: Transfer to a dish and cover, using dish inverted over it to allow bread to steam and stay moist and supple.
']

Title: No Fail Bean Pie
Ingredients: ['2 deep-dish prepared pie crusts', '2 (15.5 ounce) cans navy beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (12 fluid ounce) can evaporated milk', '½ cup butter, melted', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon grated nutmeg', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 ½ cups white sugar', '2 tablespoons vanilla extract', '2 eggs', '2 egg yolks']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place pie crusts into 9-inch pie dishes.
', 'Step 3: In a food processor, place the navy beans, evaporated milk, melted butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, flour, sugar, vanilla extract, eggs, and egg yolks; pulse the mixture a few times, then process until smooth, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Pour the filling into the prepared pie crusts.
', 'Step 5: Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for 15 minutes, then reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown, an additional 35 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Cool before slicing.
', 'Step 7: Eat warm or cold.
', 'Step 8: Refrigerate leftovers.
']

Title: Shish Tawook Grilled Chicken
Ingredients: ['¼ cup lemon juice', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '¾ cup plain yogurt', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons tomato paste', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '⅛ teaspoon ground cardamom', '2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 2 inch pieces', '2 onions, cut into large chunks', '1 large green bell pepper, cut into large chunks', '1 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk together the lemon juice, vegetable oil, plain yogurt, garlic, tomato paste, salt, oregano, pepper, allspice, cinnamon, and cardamom in a large bowl; add the chicken and toss to coat.
', 'Step 2: Transfer the chicken mixture into a large plastic bag; refrigerate at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 3: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil grate.
', 'Step 4: Thread the chicken, onions, and pepper onto metal skewers.
', 'Step 5: Cook on preheated grill until the chicken is golden and no longer pink in the center, about 5 minutes each side.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle the parsley over the skewers.
']

Title: Choereg (Armenian Easter Bread)
Ingredients: ['1 cup whole milk', '1 cup unsalted butter', '1 cup margarine', '1 cup white sugar', '½ cup lukewarm water', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '2 (.25 ounce) envelopes active dry yeast', '5 eggs', '6 cups all-purpose flour, or as needed', '1 ½ teaspoons baking powder', '1 ½ tablespoons ground mahleb', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 egg, beaten', '1 tablespoon sesame seeds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk, butter and margarine.
', 'Step 2: Heat until butter and margarine are melted, but do not let it boil.
', 'Step 3: Stir in 1 cup of sugar until dissolved, then set aside to cool to lukewarm.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, dissolve 2 teaspoons of sugar in warm water.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle the yeast over the surface, and let stand until frothy, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Crack the eggs into a large bowl, and stir a little to break up the yolks.
', 'Step 7: Slowly pour in the heated milk mixture while whisking constantly, so as to temper the eggs and not cook them.
', 'Step 8: Add the yeast mixture, and stir just until blended.
', 'Step 9: In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, mahleb, and salt.
', 'Step 10: Make a well in the center, and pour in the wet mixture.
', 'Step 11: Stir until it forms a sticky dough.
', 'Step 12: Pour onto a floured surface, and knead in additional flour as needed to make a more substantial dough.
', 'Step 13: Knead for about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Place in an oiled bowl, and set in a warm place to rise for about 2 hours, or until doubled in size.
', 'Step 15: When the dough has doubled, punch down again, and let rise until doubled.
', 'Step 16: It will only take about half as long this time.
', 'Step 17: Separate the dough into 5 even portions, then separate each of those into thirds.
', 'Step 18: Roll each of those into ropes about 12 inches long.
', 'Step 19: Braid sets of three ropes together, pinching the ends to seal, and tucking them under for a better presentation.
', 'Step 20: Place the loaves onto baking sheets lined with parchment paper.
', 'Step 21: Loaves should be spaced 4 inches apart.
', 'Step 22: Set in a warm place to rise until your finger leaves an impression behind when you poke the loaf gently.
', 'Step 23: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 24: Brush the loaves with beaten egg, and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
', 'Step 25: Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until nicely golden brown all over.
']

Title: Ashure
Ingredients: ['½ cup dry garbanzo beans', '½ cup dry white beans', '2 cups fine bulgur', '½ cup raisins', '15 cups water', '3 cups white sugar', '¼ cup dried apricots', '¼ cup orange peel, chopped', '5 whole cloves', '2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', '2 tablespoons chopped walnuts', '2 tablespoons chopped pistachio nuts', '2 tablespoons dried currants', '1 tablespoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the garbanzo beans, white beans, bulgur, and raisins in separate bowls and add water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Let stand overnight.
', 'Step 3: The next day, combine the garbanzo beans and white beans in a saucepan with water to cover.
', 'Step 4: Bring the water to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until the beans are tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 5: Drain the wheat and transfer it to a large saucepan.
', 'Step 6: Add the 15 cups water (3 quarts plus 3 cups) and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce the heat to low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes, skimming and discarding any foam that appears.
', 'Step 8: When the wheat has thickened, stir in the sugar and bring the mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Drain the cooked beans and add them to the wheat mixture.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the raisins, apricots, orange peel, and cloves.
', 'Step 11: Reduce the heat and simmer until the mixture thickens and the fruit is tender, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Pour the pudding into individual serving bowls.
', 'Step 13: Garnish with toasted sesame seeds, chopped walnuts, chopped pistachios, currants, and cinnamon.
', 'Step 14: Allow the pudding to cool and then serve.
']
